document.docTitle: Mioscarta nubisa Crispolon & Soulier-Perkins 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New genus and new species of spittlebugs (Hemiptera: Cercopidae) from the Philippines

figureCitation.captionText: Fig. 7. Mioscarta nubisa Crispolon & Soulier-Perkins sp. nov. holotype, habitus and ♂ terminalia in lateral view. A. Lateral view. B. Frontal view. C. Dorsal view. D. Labels. E. Terminalia. F. Sternolateral, intermediate and subgenital plates. G. Paramere. H. Aedeagus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
General shape of
M. nubisa
is similar to
M . obscuripennis
but are distinctly different in color.
M. nubisa
in dorsal view presents a brownish and opaque tegmen, darker toward apex, pronotum brownish and yellowish or brown legs while
M . obscuripennis
has a dark brown or black tegmen, brown or orange pronotum and orange legs.
Species name refers to the light to darker coloration forming a cloudy pattern on the tegmen and is the female superlative of the latin word “nubis” which means cloudy.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 6.
Mioscarta lutea Schmidt, 1925
, ♀ holotype habitus. A . Lateral view. B . Frontal view. C . Dorsal view. D . Labels.

subSubSection.paragraph: COLOR. Head, antennae, pronotum, abdomen, legs scutellum light brown, rostrum brownish highlighted with white. Tegmen opaque light brown to brown.
Philippines : Camarines Sur , Luzon isl. Mt Isarog Natural Park, Panicuason Naga .
